unnormalised: The Ministry of Education has mandated the linking of Aadhaar numbers with student IDs to streamline scholarship disbursement, according to a circular issued on 10/11/2024. This directive aims to eliminate fraudulent claims and ensure that financial aid reaches deserving candidates. Students are required to submit their 12-digit Aadhaar nos. to their respective institutions by 30/12/2024 to continue receiving benefits under various central and state government schemes.
normalised: The Ministry of Education has mandated the linking of A-A-D-H-A-A-R numbers with student I-D-s to streamline scholarship disbursement, according to a circular issued on tenth November two thousand and twenty four. This directive aims to eliminate fraudulent claims and ensure that financial aid reaches deserving candidates. Students are required to submit their twelve-digit A-A-D-H-A-A-R numbers to their respective institutions by thirtieth December two thousand and twenty four to continue receiving benefits under various central and state government schemes.

unnormalised: The move has triggered mixed reactions from educational institutions and student bodies. While many support the initiative as a measure to enhance transparency, concerns have been raised regarding data privacy and potential exclusion of students who may not possess an Aadhaar card. The ministry has clarified that alternative identification documents, such as PAN cards and voter IDs, can be used in exceptional cases, but the Aadhaar number remains the preferred mode of identification.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the Ministry of Labor and Employment has announced that all employees registered under the EPFO (Employees' Provident Fund Organisation) must link their UAN (Universal Account Number) with their Aadhaar card by 31st Jan 2025. This measure is intended to prevent multiple accounts and improve the efficiency of fund transfers and withdrawals. Employees failing to comply with the deadline may face restrictions on accessing their provident fund benefits.

unnormalised: Trade unions have expressed reservations about the mandatory linking of Aadhaar with employment identifiers, citing potential misuse of data and surveillance. The ministry has assured that robust data protection protocols are in place to safeguard the information of employees.
